comment._content: Maybe the free masons know something about this guy.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/danieltoschlaeger] Well spotted! That apron is certainly a masonic one. Thanks for clearing that up, our records have been updated.

comment.author: 79371310@N02
comment._content: I don't know how deep your ambitions are, but I found this freemasondatabase.com/ via google. It seams, it is a search engine for members.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/danieltoschlaeger] thanks! We have a couple images of this guy, so perhaps we will be able to track down his name one of these days :)

comment.author: 21728045@N08
comment._content: Someone would have to email a request to the various Australian Grand Lodges asking them to email their lodge secretaries to ask their brethren if they could ID this Master Mason. Perhaps in later years he became Master of a lodge or a member of one of the Grand Lodges. If his surname was Hooker, they'd have him listed on their rolls. www.google.ca/#q=the+grand+lodge+of+australia

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/21728045@N08] Thank you! If we hear of anything we will post it here  :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 21728045@N08
comment._content: It may be prudent for a Mason of your acquaintance to make that enquiry, possibly through a Grand Secretary in the Grand Lodge in the state in which you are based.

comment.author: 62609412@N02
comment._content: Hello, this man is wearing a master mason third degree apron of the United Grand Lodge of England...I understand Worshipful masters in Australia used to wear black tails and white tie, but this fellow is not Wearing a WM's apron......hope this helps?
